result.title: How to derive number of correct bracket sequences?
result.content:
Hi. Recently I encountered one problem which turned out to be unexpectably hard for me. How to compute number of correct bracket sequences of given length? Correct bracket sequence are defined ass follows:
Empty string is a correct bracket sequence
If R is a correct bracket sequence then (R) is also a correct one
If R and Q are correct bracket sequences then RQ is also a correct one.

In site where I encountered it we have n ≤ 60 (n is the total length of a sequence) which seems pretty small, but I'm unable to solve this either way. After some thought I noted that n has to be odd, but it was the only helpful observation I came up with after long time. Using backtrack is clearly too slow, so I optimized this using "Meet In The Middle" technique, but that is too slow as well. Any help will be appreciated.
